text: Baker's have long since known that
adding a little bit of espresso powder
to their chocolaty goods only
intensifies that rich chocolaty flavor
but I like to use espresso powder in a
lot of other different ways so I want to
show you four of my favorites the first
one is a spicy steak rub all you have to
do is combine one teaspoon of a smoked
paprika 1 teaspoon of a light brown
sugar 2 teaspoons of the espresso powder
and 2 teaspoons of coarse salt mix this
all together there's something about
that smokiness of the paprika the
sweetness of the brown sugar and that
rich depth of flavor in the espresso
powder that really pairs nicely with
beef but once this is all combined just
sprinkle it on both sides of a steak I
have a strip steak here you really want
a nice coating on this Pat it right into
the meat some will fall off so you
really go more than you think you need
on here same on the other side you can
really play around with this you could
try other spices in here cayenne pepper
would be great if you want some more
heat if you wanted to try cumin or
coriander that would be a really nice
blend so that's all there is to it so
then you can cook this however you want
you can broil it I think I'm gonna grill
mine and we'll really taste the
wonderful flavor that espresso powder
brings to a piece of steak try it on
your favorite cut of beef I know you're
gonna love it
here is another great way to use some
espresso powder and pick up your morning
routine I love doing cinnamon toast in
the morning this adds a little bit of
spresso powder to that usual mix of
sugar and cinnamon so just 1 tablespoon
of sugar teaspoon of cinnamon teaspoon
of espresso powder you get your coffee
and your toast in 1 mix this together
butter your toast
a good amount of butter is key here when
we get your cinnamon sugar espresso mix
to stick on there and then just sprinkle
on the sugar mixture this is a delicious
little pick-me-up for any morning here's
a great way to perk up your dessert all
you need is some lemon sorbet and some
of that delicious espresso powder so
just scoop your lemon sorbet into a bowl
that leaves three scoops and then a
little pinch of espresso powder over the
top this is like the dessert version of
having a lemon twist in your espresso if
you want you can do a little lemon zest
over the top then you'll add something
pretty and there you have it an instant
dessert with great new flavor here's a
great idea for a hot winter toddy I'm
calling it a mocha Russian all happens
in a pot I've got a quarter cup of light
brown sugar for sweetness a tablespoon
of cocoa powder two tablespoons of our
beloved espresso powder whisk this
together and then two cups of whole milk
whisk it in
and a half a cup of heavy cream that's
just for some richness then if you want
a quarter cup of vodka this is just
enough to give it a little kick okay he
says until it's almost boiling and then
we can top it with some whipped cream
okay let's serve up our winter hot toddy
it's all nice and warm ladle it into
this mug you could make this in a really
big batch and send it out for a warm
punch at a party okay and for our final
touch some whipped cream on top and a
little sprinkle of espresso powder a
delicious and decadent drink great for
any holiday party and with so many great
uses for espresso powder it's definitely
a pantry staple
you
you
